docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 20. -- Dr. Oswaldo Aranha, Brazilian Ambassador to the United States, will fight the political battle of his life at Bahia tomorrow with the Presidency of Brazil as the possible prize. His conference there with President...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 20. -- Dr. Oswaldo Aranha, Brazilian Ambassador to the United States, will fight the political battle of his life at Bahia tomorrow with the Presidency of Brazil as the possible prize. His conference there with President Getulio Vargas will probably determine whether Dr. Aranha will be the successor to the mantle the President is expected to discard in 1938.
docs.abstract: Aranha to confer with Vargas on Pres candidacy; complicated situation

headline.main: BRAZIL PRESIDENCY DEPENDS ON PARLEY; Aranha, Envoy to U.S., to Confers With Vargas Today on the Question. HELD LEADING CANDIDATE Governor of Sao Paulo Shows Up as Strongest Competitor -- Situation Complicated.

byline.original: By HAROLD HINTONWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: AVILA, Spain, Nov. 23. -- This writer escaped capture by Madrid troops on Saturday when, bed-ridden with influenza, he was unable to join other correspondents in a tour of the Madrid front. Four of the correspondents were captured by the Leftists in...
docs.lead_paragraph: AVILA, Spain, Nov. 23. -- This writer escaped capture by Madrid troops on Saturday when, bed-ridden with influenza, he was unable to join other correspondents in a tour of the Madrid front. Four of the correspondents were captured by the Leftists in the Casade Campo, on the western outskirts of Madrid.
docs.abstract: Captured with 3 other correspondents by Leftists while on tour of Madrid front

byline.original: By GEORGE AXELSSONWireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 24. -- Secretary of State Cordell Hull received a warm welcome here today. He revisited the scenes of the Pan-American Conference of three years ago, although he stayed ashore only a few hours.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 24. -- Secretary of State Cordell Hull urged the nations of the two American continents today to "rededicate" themselves to the "cause of peace and economic progress." He proposed that they provide "inspiration and a guide...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, Nov. 24. -- Secretary of State Cordell Hull urged the nations of the two American continents today to "rededicate" themselves to the "cause of peace and economic progress." He proposed that they provide "inspiration and a guide to a world sorely needing leadership and enlightened statesmanship."

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 24. -- President Roosevelt's visit and the Spanish civil war momentarily became matters of secondary interest today as newspapers announced with first-page streamers the award of the 1936 Nobel Peace Prize to Dr. Carlos Saavedra...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Nov. 24. -- President Roosevelt's visit and the Spanish civil war momentarily became matters of secondary interest today as newspapers announced with first-page streamers the award of the 1936 Nobel Peace Prize to Dr. Carlos Saavedra Lamas.

headline.main: SAAVEDRA LAMAS WROTE PEACE PACT; Nobel Prize Winner's Treaty to Outlaw War in Americas Was Signed April 27, '34. HE URGED WORLD ACCORDS Argentine Foreign Minister Has Been Active in the League and Other Groups of States.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: One of the great hopes lodged in the forthcoming conference of the American republics at Buenos Aires is that a common mood will be formed to discourage war, not only in this hemisphere, but in the other. Peace is the dominant impulse of the...
docs.lead_paragraph: One of the great hopes lodged in the forthcoming conference of the American republics at Buenos Aires is that a common mood will be formed to discourage war, not only in this hemisphere, but in the other. Peace is the dominant impulse of the conferees, and to fix and dramatize that impulse the greatest peace salesman in the world, the President of the United States, is on his way to Buenos Aires.
docs.abstract: A Krock on hopes for peace and Roosevelt's position

headline.main: In The Nation; Effect of Pan-American Anti-War Combine.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Nov. 25. -- The police had to be called in last night to keep peace in the People's Conference in Favor of Peace after the delegation of American feminists had split and started a lively battle over the question of whether...
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Argentina, Nov. 25. -- The police had to be called in last night to keep peace in the People's Conference in Favor of Peace after the delegation of American feminists had split and started a lively battle over the question of whether women want protection or equal rights with men.
docs.abstract: People's Conf in Favor of Peace meeting split over question of protection or equal rights; proclamation to be presented to Pan-Amer peace conf
